ratings.comment: He's a professor who doesn't dumb his German down for you. He speaks with native fluency about some really advanced topics in literature and calls you out when you attempt to use English. In this way, he is very intimidating. However, he's a good prof. Always encouraged discussion and ideas. You can get an easy A if you try. He improved my German.
Very good!!! I wish he teaches other non-German courses so that I can take them!

Sweet guy, if slightly intimidating. Lectures weren't always "easy" to follow, but he always made an effort to engage the class and encourage participation. Def recommended for anyone interested in Kafka.

Professor Adler is one of the few German professors who can keep you interested in a discussion through a whole power lecture!  He picks a good selection of interesting books, and the class is fairly easy if you read the books and come to class.  Expect though that he tends to be intimidating and will call you out on mispronunciations!

Superficial course. He encouraged discussion yet cut people off.He challenged comments destructively.Lied to cover himself; shrouded common sense in lit-speak.Dropped names and terms - him connecting them was very thin, intentionally obscure. A Very Important Man, so humble. His Burrow breathing comment: you would need a "structure." Sooo abstract.

Good teacher, truly wants you to understand the material. Sometimes confusing but thats just the nature of the readings. Exams are straight forward, attendance is graded. Go to class, stay awake, get a good grade.

Professor Adler is well-spoken and intelligent.  The writing assignments were short and easy, and the tests covered things that were specifically talked about in class.  Attendance was mandatory because he passed around a sign-in sheet at every lecture.  Fun, easy class.

Pretty easy class and interesting material. Not so much about interpretation of Kafka's text, but more of what was said in lecture. You must go to lecture because he passes around a sign in sheet. 2 easy (250 word) papers, 1 easy blue book midterm and easy blue book final. Take it if you have any interest in Kafka.
